column4: since you said you have a router, you have to forward a port on your router through to each machine you want to run bittorrent on, and assuming azureus uses the same default port on each installation, you would have to change azureus settings on each machine to be a different port, and forward each on your router
see my reply from a few minutes ago

I've found the latest realvnc client better than tightvnc, in windows

since you said you have a router, you have to forward a port on your router through to each machine you want to run bittorrent on, and assuming azureus uses the same default port on each installation, you would have to change azureus settings on each machine to be a different port, and forward each on your router
how do i get into my routers settings ?
but each would need a different port, then on the router you can forward the appropriate port to the appropriate IP
most have web interface, and most are 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1 by default
your router, did you ever figure out how to get into the web config page?
